title: Lindsay Lohan claims she was 'racially profiled' while wearing headscarf at airport amid reports she's converting to Islam
text:
Lindsay Lohan claims she was 'racially profiled' while wearing headscarf at airport amid reports she's converting to Islam The star admits the moment freaked her out Share Comments By Alistair McGeorge 08:54, 21 FEB 2017 Updated 09:08, 21 FEB 2017 TV Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Good Morning Britain: Kate Garraway reveals 'heat Watch this video again Watch Next Good Morning Britain: Laura Main discusses Mirand 0:55 Lindsay Lohan swears at crowd to 'shut the f**k u 1:00 Journalist who spoke to Lindsay Lohan after 'figh 0:46 Lindsay Lohan's horrific fight with Egor 0:57 Classic intro to TV show The Bill 0:37 Joey Essex has Phil and Holly in hysterics as he 0:30 This Morning technical error means viewers end up 0:30 Holly Willoughby horrified as Julia Keys reveals 0:30 Holly reveals she saved someone whilst skiing 0:29 Kyle guest thinks partner cheated because golden 0:23 Paisley Billings in Tattoo fixers 0:30 "But, what would you do if you had diarrhoea?" 0:37 Video will play in Lindsay Lohan claims she was RACIALLY PROFILED at Heathrow Share this video Watch Next celebs Lindsay Lohan has claimed she was "racially profiled" as she was flying into London from Turkey while wearing a headscarf.
The star is remaining coy over reports she is converting to Islam but admitted it is "a consideration", and spoke of the incident after a recent flight.
Speaking on ITV's Good Morning Britain, she claimed: "I got stopped recently and was racially profiled... She opened my passport, saw 'Lindsay Lohan' and immediately started apologising. But then said take off your headscarf."
Lindsay Lohan on GMB (Photo: ITV) She claimed she was "racially profiled" in a headscarf (Photo: ITV) The Mean Girls actress was "kind of shocked" by the incident, but added that she couldn't "speak for what the purpose" of being stopped actually was.
Asked whether she is converting to Islam, Lindsay explained that it's something she has an interest in and that she's studying the Quaran.
The star seemed in good spirits (Photo: ITV) She admitted she was nervous about chatting to Piers (Photo: ITV) "I don't wanna speak on something that I haven't finished yet. I don't think that's right," she said. "It's a consideration I have."
During the candid chat with Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid, she also defended US president Donald Trump and agreed that the hysteria could be overplayed.
Lindsay has backed Donald Trump (Photo: Getty) "People are making it overly dramatic," she said. "What's the point in picking on someone in case of just seeing what they're capable of, or not capable of?"
Meanwhile, she also admitted she called good friend Oprah Winfrey the night before her interview - because she was nervous about speaking to Piers.
"I was nervous to talk to you," Lindsay laughed. "She was talking about what I'm doing now... I always check in with her."
